item.title: Harris is pressed on the concerns of Black voters in Charlamagne tha God town hall
item.description: Harris’ town hall with the influential radio host came at a crucial moment in the campaign, as polls show her struggling to cement the level of support she may need from Black men to win the White House.

item.title: Israel threatens to starve out northern Gaza, U.N. aid agencies say
item.description: Israel has allowed almost no food aid into north Gaza for two weeks. Humanitarian groups say it leaves 400,000 people with the choice of eventual starvation or fleeing their homes to the south.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: ‘My losses started the day I was born’: A poet on what it’s like to call Gaza home
item.description: Mosab Abu Toha was able to escape Gaza, along with his wife and three young children. The award-winning poet talks about parenting in war and the devastation of leaving his family and friends behind.

item.title: U.S. woman wins conkers world title, as men's champ faces metal nut cheating charges
item.description: An autumn tournament for conkers, a traditional English game, has drawn people to a country pub for years. But now a scandal — or conkerversy — is brewing after an accusation of cheating.

item.title: Wise words from Sister Rosita, age 79: A math lover wins U.N. prize for refugee relief
item.description: Rosita Milesi was honored with the U.N. Refugee Agency's Nansen Refugee Award for 40 years of activism. The U.N. calls her a "formidable refugee champion." And she has life lessons to share.

item.title: Lufthansa agrees to a record $4 million fine for its treatment of Jewish passengers
item.description: The German airline barred 128 Jewish passengers from their May 2022 connecting flight based on the alleged misconduct of a few. The U.S. government considers that discrimination; Lufthansa disagrees.

item.title: Walgreens will close 1,200 stores, hoping for a turnaround
item.description: Walgreens says about a quarter of its stores are unprofitable. Big pharmacy chains are struggling with growing retail competition and lower prescription payouts.

item.title: Local board members in Georgia can't refuse to certify election results, judge rules
item.description: Local election board members in Georgia cannot refuse to certify election results in any scenario, even if they report concerns about fraud or errors, a state judge has ruled.
